name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: _[SOUND] This lecture is about

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: _Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: _covering
column6: Motivation. _

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: _In this lecture
column6: we're going to start

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: mining a different kind of knowledge.

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: _Namely
column6: knowledge about the observer or humans that have generated the text data. _

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: _In particular
column6: we're going to talk about the opinion mining and sentiment analysis. _

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: _As we discussed earlier
column6: text data can be regarded as data generated _

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: from humans as subjective sensors.

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: _In contrast
column6: we have other devices such as video recorder that can report what's _

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: happening in the real world objective to generate the viewer data for example.

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: _Now the main difference between test data and other data
column6: like video data

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: _is that it has rich opinions

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: and the content tends to be subjective because it's generated from humans.

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: _Now
column6: this is actually a unique advantaged of text data

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: because the office is a great opportunity to understand the observers.

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: We can mine text data to understand their opinions.

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: _Understand people's preferences
column6: how people think about something. _

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: So this lecture and the following lectures will be mainly about how we can mine and

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: analyze opinions buried in a lot of text data.

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: So let's start with the concept of opinion.

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: _It's not that easy to formally define opinion
column6: but _

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: mostly we would define opinion as a subjective

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: statement describing what a person believes or thinks about something.

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: _Now
column6: I highlighted quite a few words here. _

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: And that's because it's worth thinking a little bit more about these words.

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: And that will help us better understand what's in an opinion.

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: And this further helps us to define opinion more formally.

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: Which is always needed to computation to resolve the problem of opinion mining.

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: So let's first look at the key word of subjective here.

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: This is in contrast with objective statement or factual statement.

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: Those statements can be proved right or wrong.

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: And this is a key differentiating factor from opinions

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: which tends to be not easy to prove wrong or

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: _right
column6: because it reflects what the person thinks about something. _

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: _So in contrast
column6: objective statement can usually be proved wrong or correct. _

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: _For example
column6: you might say this computer has a screen and a battery. _

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: Now that's something you can check.

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: It's either having a battery or not.

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: _But in contrast with this
column6: think about the sentence such as

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: the best battery or this laptop has a nice screen.

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: Now these statements are more subjective and

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: it's very hard to prove whether it's wrong or correct.

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: _So opinion
column6: is a subjective statement. _

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: And next lets look at the keyword person here.

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: And that indicates that is an opinion holder.

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: _Because when we talk about opinion
column6: it's about an opinion held by someone. _

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: And then we notice that there is something here.

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: So that is the target of the opinion.

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: The opinion is expressed on this something.

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: _And now
column6: of course

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: an opinion will depend on the culture or background and the context in general.

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: Because a person might think different in a different context.

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: People from different background may also think in different ways.

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: So this analysis shows that there are multiple elements that we need to include

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: in order to characterize opinion.

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: _So
column6: what's a basic opinion representation like? _

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: _Well
column6: it should include at least three elements

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: _Firstly
column6: it has to specify what's the opinion holder. _

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: So whose opinion is this?

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: _Second
column6: it must also specify the target

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: _And third
column6: of course

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: And so what exactly is opinion?

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: _If you can identify these

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: we get a basic understanding of opinion and can already be useful sometimes.

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: _You want to understand further
column6: we want enriched opinion representation. _

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: _And that means we also want to understand that
column6: for example

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: the context of the opinion and what situation was the opinion expressed.

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: _For example
column6: what time was it expressed? _

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: _We
column6: also

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: to understand that what the opinion tells us about the opinion holder's feeling.

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: _For example
column6: is this opinion positive

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: _Or perhaps the opinion holder was happy or was sad
column6: and _

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: so such understanding obvious to those beyond just Extracting

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: _the opinion content
column6: it needs some analysis. _

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: So let's take a simple example of a product review.

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: _In this case
column6: this actually expressed the opinion holder

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: So its obviously whats opinion holder and

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: that's just reviewer and its also often very clear whats the opinion target and

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: that's the product review for example iPhone 6.

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: When the review is posted usually you can't such information easier.

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: _Now the content
column6: of course

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: also easy to obtain.

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: So you can see product reviews are fairly

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: easy to analyze in terms of obtaining a basic opinion of representation.

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: _But of course
column6: if you want to get more information

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: for example.

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: The review was written in 2015.

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: _Or
column6: we want to know that the sentiment of this review is positive. _

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: _So
column6: this additional understanding of course adds value to mining the opinions. _

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: _Now
column6: you can see in this case the task is relatively easy and that's _

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: because the opinion holder and the opinion target have already been identified.

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: Now let's take a look at the sentence in the news.

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: _In this case
column6: we have a implicit holder and a implicit target. _

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: And the tasker is in general harder.

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: _So
column6: we can identify opinion holder here
column7: and that's the governor of Connecticut. _

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: We can also identify the target.

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: _So one target is Hurricane Sandy
column6: but _

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: there is also another target mentioned which is hurricane of 1938.

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: So what's the opinion?

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: _Well
column6: there's a negative sentiment here _

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: that's indicated by words like bad and worst.

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: _And we can also
column6: then

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: _Now
column6: unlike in the playoff review

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: all these elements must be extracted by using natural RAM processing techniques.

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: _So
column6: the task Is much harder. _

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: And we need a deeper natural language processing.

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: And these examples also

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: suggest that a lot of work can be easy to done for product reviews.

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: That's indeed what has happened.

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: _Analyzing and assembling news is still quite difficult

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: it's more difficult than the analysis of opinions in product reviews.

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: Now there are also some other interesting variations.

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: _In fact
column6: here we're going to examine the variations of opinions

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: more systematically.

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: _First
column6: let's think about the opinion holder. _

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: The holder could be an individual or it could be group of people.

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: _Sometimes
column6: the opinion was from a committee. _

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: Or from a whole country of people.

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: Opinion target accounts will vary a lot.

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: _It can be about one entity
column6: a particular person

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: _a particular policy
column6: ect. _

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: But it could be about a group of products.

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: Could be about the products from a company in general.

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: _Could also be very specific about one attribute
column6: though. _

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: An attribute of the entity.

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: _For example
column6: it's just about the battery of iPhone. _

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: It could be someone else's opinion.

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: _And one person might comment on another person's Opinion
column6: etc. _

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: _So
column6: you can see there is a lot of variation here that will cause _

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: the problem to vary a lot.

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: _Now
column6: opinion content
column8: can also vary a lot on the surface

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: you can identify one-sentence opinion or one-phrase opinion.

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: _But you can also have longer text to express an opinion

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: like the whole article.

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: And furthermore we identify the variation in the sentiment or

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: emotion damage that's above the feeding of the opinion holder.

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: _So
column6: we can distinguish a positive versus negative or mutual or _

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: _happy versus sad
column6: separate. _

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: _Finally
column6: the opinion context can also vary. _

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: _We can have a simple context
column6: like different time or different locations. _

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: _But there could be also complex contexts

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: such as some background of topic being discussed.

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: _So when opinion is expressed in particular discourse context
column6: it has to _

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: be interpreted in different ways than when it's expressed in another context.

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: So the context can be very [INAUDIBLE] to entire discourse context of the opinion.

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: _From computational perspective

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: we're mostly interested in what opinions can be extracted from text data.

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: _So
column6: it turns out that we can also differentiate

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: different kinds of opinions in text data from computation perspective.

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: _First
column6: the observer might make a comment about opinion targeting

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: observe the word So in case we have the author's opinion.

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: _For example
column6: I don't like this phone at all. _

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: And that's an opinion of this author.

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: _In contrast
column6: the text might also report opinions about others. _

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: So the person could also Make observation about another person's opinion and

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: reported this opinion.

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: _So for example
column6: I believe he loves the painting. _

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: And that opinion is really about the It is really expressed by another person here.

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: _So
column6: it doesn't mean this author loves that painting. _

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: _So clearly
column6: the two kinds of opinions need to be analyzed in different ways

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: _and sometimes in product reviews

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: _you can see
column6: although mostly the opinions are false from this reviewer. _

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: _Sometimes
column6: a reviewer might mention opinions of his friend or her friend. _

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: Another complication is that there may be indirect opinions or

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: inferred opinions that can be obtained.

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: By making inferences on

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: what's expressed in the text that might not necessarily look like opinion.

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: _For example
column6: one statement that might be

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: this phone ran out of battery in just one hour.

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: _Now
column6: this is in a way a factual statement because It's either true or false

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: _You can even verify that
column6: but from this statement

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: one can also infer some negative opinions about the quality of the battery of

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: _this phone
column6: or the feeling of the opinion holder about the battery. _

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: The opinion holder clearly wished that the battery do last longer.

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: So these are interesting variations that we need to pay attention to when we

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: extract opinions.

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: _Also
column6: for this reason about indirect opinions

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: it's often also very useful to extract whatever the person has said about

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: _the product
column6: and sometimes factual sentences like these are also very useful. _

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: _So
column6: from a practical viewpoint

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: sometimes we don't necessarily extract the subject of sentences.

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: _Instead
column6: again
column7: all the sentences that are about the opinions are useful for _

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: understanding the person or understanding the product that we commend.

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: So the task of opinion mining can be defined as taking textualized input

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: to generate a set of opinion representations.

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: _Each representation we should identify opinion holder

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: _target
column6: content

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: Ideally we can also infer opinion sentiment from the comment and

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: the context to better understand.

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: The opinion.

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: _Now often
column6: some elements of the representation are already known. _

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: I just gave a good example in the case of product we'd use

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: where the opinion holder and the opinion target are often expressly identified.

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: And that's not why this turns out to be one of the simplest opinion mining tasks.

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: _Now
column6: it's interesting to think about the other tasks that might be also simple. _

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: Because those are the cases where you can easily build

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: applications by using opinion mining techniques.

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: _So now that we have talked about what is opinion mining
column6: we have defined the task. _

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: Let's also just talk a little bit about why opinion mining is very important and

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: why it's very useful.

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: _So here
column6: I identify three major reasons

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: The first is it can help decision support.

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: It can help us optimize our decisions.

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: _We often look at other people's opinions
column6: look at read the reviews _

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: in order to make a decisions like buying a product or using a service.

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: We also would be interested in others opinions

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: when we decide whom to vote for example.

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: _And policy makers

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: may also want to know people's opinions when designing a new policy.

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: _So that's one general
column6: kind of

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: _And it's very broad
column6: of course. _

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: _The second application is to understand people
column6: and this is also very important. _

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: _For example
column6: it could help understand people's preferences. _

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: And this could help us better serve people.

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: _For example
column6: we optimize a product search engine or optimize a recommender system _

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: _if we know what people are interested in
column6: what people think about product. _

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: _It can also help with advertising
column6: of course

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: advertising if we know what kind of people tend to like what kind of plot.

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: Now the third kind of application can be called voluntary survey.

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: _Now this is most important research that used to be done by doing surveys

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: doing manual surveys.

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: _Question
column6: answer it. _

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: People need to feel informs to answer their questions.

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: _Now this is directly related to humans as sensors
column6: and we can usually aggregate _

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: opinions from a lot of humans through kind of assess the general opinion.

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: Now this would be very useful for business intelligence where manufacturers

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: want to know where their products have advantages over others.

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: _What are the winning features of their products

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: winning features of competitive products.

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: Market research has to do with understanding consumers oppinions.

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: And this create very useful directive for that.

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: Data-driven social science research can benefit from this because they can

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: do text mining to understand the people's opinions.

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: _And if you can aggregate a lot of opinions from social media
column6: from a lot of

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: information then you can actually do some study of some questions.

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: _For example
column6: we can study the behavior of people on social media on social networks. _

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: And these can be regarded as voluntary survey done by those people.

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: _In general
column6: we can gain a lot of advantage in any prediction task because we can _

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: leverage the text data as extra data above any problem.

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: And so we can use text based prediction techniques to help you

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: make predictions or improve the accuracy of prediction.

name: 5 - 1 - 4.1 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Motivation (00-17-51).srt
text: [MUSIC]
